description.narrative: Increased cross-border flows prompted by the project will help to make equity markets in smaller and frontier countries more robust by - among other things - improving market liquidity, issuer transparency and disclosure, as well as overall equity market infrastructure. In turn, such improvements should facilitate future primary market issuance and financing options for companies in these countries, thereby promoting economic growth and enabling poverty reduction. Development of equity markets in targeted smaller and frontier countries will also benefit from the IFC Advisory Services program.

The Project is an initiative in which AllianceBernstein will deploy crossborder investment capital into publicly traded private sector equities in smaller and frontier markets, in which IFC expects to provide anchor capital. The project will be accompanied by a parallel, but separately funded and managed Advisory Services program managed by IFC. This program will aim to improve underpinnings for sustainable capital markets development in a subset of smaller and frontier markets included in this initiative.

participating-org.narrative: ALLIANCEBERNSTEIN NEXT 50 EMERGING MARKETS (LUXEMBOURG) FUND SICAV-SIF S.C.SP

name.narrative: IFC investable countries that, among other things, are not large (in terms of GDP), and have nascent or less mature capital markets as well as weak portfolio investment flows.
